reviews.text: We came here for dinner and we absolutely loved our experience! The interior of the whole restaurant feels so homey and cozy with the lovely decor and ambiance. The food is delicious, and the service is unbeatable. We ordered from the family style menu, and we got the Caesar salad, Maggiano’s salad, calamari fritté, stuffed mushrooms, famous rigatoni “D”, mom’s lasagna, shrimp scampi, red snapper, and the dessert sampler. Absolutely everything we ordered was phenomenal, and we loved the option of ordering from the family style menu. The service was excellent, and our server was very attentive to our needs at every point throughout the meal. We will definitely be back again for the family style menu when we’re in the area!

The food was delicious, we had breaded chicken and lasagna.  My kids really love those kids' meals with homemade ice cream at the end.  Sydney was really patient and great! We really enjoyed our family time.  Loved the $5 take-home meal deal. Nice holiday music.

Delicious food, and the staff are smart!
Staff here can remember large orders with many alterations, and the food still comes out fast. I wish they had more non-alcoholic drink options, though.

Also, the vibes in here are great! Lovely decor, low lighting is good for a date.
Try the 5$ take-home dinners!

You can get your parking ticket validated here, there is a direct elevator entrance from the parking garage. Highly recommended!

My friend had recommended Maggianos as an anniversary dinner spot so we decided to visit late December. Overall, in terms of food, it’s a bit lackluster. My partner and I suspect the food was microwaved because the pasta did not taste fresh and the mashed potatoes were disappointingly clumped as one doughy ball. We had the eggplant and calamari appetizers, the lasagna, eggplant parmigiana, side of mashed potatoes, tiramisu, and lemon cookies (see photos). Out of all of those, I loved the eggplant appetizer. It’s a heart attack but worth it. My partner loved the calamari appetizer and its dipping tomato sauce.

Also, although our waitress forgot my salmon add-on request to the eggplant pasta and still charged me for it, she was sincerely apologetic when we pointed out the missing salmon and had the receipt edited to have that removed. I gave this 3 stars because despite the food quality of the entrees and sides, this restaurant does have huge portions for their prices and friendly staff and service.

Side note: I would recommend this restaurant for large family or friend get-togethers since when we went, there were kids running around and a group of ladies constantly screaming and squealing as they had some sort of gift opening exchange going on and were throwing their gift wrapping trash everywhere. We had a loud experience so if you’re going for a quiet dinner, avoid the main dining area.

I ordered the lobster carbonara… it’s something I’ve ordered it a few times at the location in a different city. This first time ordering here. The pasta sauce has a very chalky, bitter taste, the lobster was chewy and flavorless and there was not the same amount of bacon. It just didn’t taste as good  unfortunately.

It’s all about the experience when you come here (and the free unlimited bread which is always the best thing on the table) I got the soft chicken tacos and they were 90% onions but the fries were surprisingly good. Our waitress was so so lovely and attentive. She was willing to accommodate our large party and all of our needs. The Long Island iced tea was a nice pour and decent size even though it was a bit pricy. Overall, the vibe is the goal here and it was accomplished based on the bread and the waitress alone.

Great service, hot and prompt food. I tried the clam chowder and salad. It was my first time trying clam chowder and it was pretty good. I also asked to swap the regular salad with the mix greens (no croutons). Everything tasted fresh. Also had a margarita and the sugar free cheesecake. Really surprised at how good that sugar free cheesecake was! Also, our waitress Brittany was excellent and attentive.

Had a great dinner with my boyfriend and mother. Our server was more than great. She went above and beyond for us. Food was pretty good. Wish it was a little better but I know the place is mainly well known for their impeccable cheesecakes! Got the dulce de leche caramel cheesecake and it is delicious!

This will be my first and last time coming to this place . I brought my son here for his 13th  birthday excited hoping for amazing food and good services. Sadly the waitress Sahara was rude and uncaring. She seemed disoriented and confused. She was muttering things  I had to ask her to repeat herself several times not sure if she was new or what her deal was. She asked what we wanted to drink 3 different times as if she not write it down or wasn’t  paying attention. On top of that the food was nasty. Salty wings, soggy asparagus.
I didn’t even get what I asked for I asked for ranch got blue cheese asked for no scallions on the nachos got extra scallions. It was ridiculous. I had mentioned from the beginning it was my sons 13 birthday and that I wanted a surprise birthday song and a slice of velvet cake for him. When she brought us the the slice of cake at the end she didn’t even acknowledge my son and just placed the cake in the table no birthday son no happy birthday just placed it on the table and left. I honestly didn’t want to tip her but not coming to this place ever again solves the problem.

Thank you Ms. Ny for a great late night dining experience!!! You are very professional and an awesome asset to this franchise!!! Note, the pepperoni on the flatbread pizza is somewhat spicy but good. The buffalo blasts are really small in size. In the past, the portion size was more than ample to share this dish. They are not worth $16.00 unless you simply like or love them.  They were very good and the minced-like chicken was tender.

NOTE, the 2 star rating is due to the very RUDE brown-skin lady who works in the bakery.  I politely said excuse me twice while she looked me and my child in the face, ignored us, and continued to wipe down the refrigerated equipment.  Her co-worker was kind enough to acknowledge us.  I explained to her that I don't take food in restrooms and asked her if we could leave our food on the counter until we returned from the restrooms. When we returned to retrieve our food she said have a good evening!!!
The type of disrespect and unprofessionalism she exhibited  is totally unacceptable! What was the purpose? #POORHospitality at the Cheesecake Factory.

Staff argued me too long to convince them to toast my wrapped chipotle sandwich until I felt I am asking for something wrong.
The place is good, clean and big.
The wrapped chipotle steak and cheese was good as the other subway restaurants. It is hard to find a free parking to get into the mall  where the subway located. But you don't need to dig too deep in the mall to find it, as it is located next to the garage entrance.
BTW I got that wrapped chipotle steak and cheese plus small chips and a drink and I payed almost $12 which is too much.
Another Veggie Delight helping me toward my weight loss goal. I love that these places are so reliably similar!
Went to get a sandwich and the way they make sandwich is worst. Would not go there
Its clean and inviting, I enjoy my visits there.
nice employees and good food

Love this place !!! I went for the first time this past week and to my expectations it was lovely and I absolutely enjoyed EVERYTHING we ordered. We had an extremely friendly server and she made out experience that much better. Starting with drinks we ordered the cherry blossom mule and yes ! It was delicious .. I got the kale Caesar salad with salmon.. Very tasty and the portion was perfect. I will most certainly will returning!!
Very good. Fresh and tasty meals. I tried the Ricotta, Mushroom and Onion Pizza and the Short Rib Ravioli with brown butter and sage.

I regretfully chose Lia's to take my visiting niece for lunch during the recent restaurant week.  I have a gluten sensitivity but saw that the burrata was listed gluten-free so I asked the waiter about the flat bread.  He informed me that a hamburger bun would be substituted.  Odd but I said "okay, that's fine but can I have it grilled or toasted?"  He said it could only be microwaved.  My guest tried asking why a separate pan couldn't be used but I was worried about the time so I just let it go but the bread was really not good at all.

The waiter was a complete clown - he "danced" between tables. Then we had a problem with the check - I received the bill from a nearby table (along with their bank card) and I was already very late to get back to work.  I had informed the waiter that I was on my lunch hour and we still ended up being at the restaurant for 75 minutes and it was not even busy.  I took my dessert with me because there was not enough time to eat it there.  When I got to work, I realized it was completely sunken in the middle with the whipped cream melted.  My niece said it must have been microwaved.  I could have prepared much better food myself at home.

NOTE:  This happened in January and I initially did not want to leave a bad review so I contacted the restaurant directly but was quite disappointed with the response.  The manager simply replied that they will do better and she hopes I'll visit again.  I don't expect to be comped for every complaint I make and sometimes I even keep quiet because I don't want to appear as if I'm just trying to get a freebie.  But this incident and the way it was handled makes me feel cheated.  She did say that I could visit their website to sign up for promotions.  No thanks!

Lia's food was great and met expectations. Nothing too fancy, more in the simple and straightforward style in terms of cooking, the food was fulfilling. The service was good, the waiter was attentive and the atmosphere was nice, calm and vibrant. I liked the Italian style menu, and including pizza there just made it even better. Definitely recommend for a nice, casual and budget friendly dinner!

Had a fabulous lunch on the patio with friends.  Our server, Bryanna was simply fabulous!  She made wonderful suggestions ( we love the insiders view) and everything was prepared perfectly.  There is a string ‘team ‘ feel at Lias - with every one making sure your drink is filled, or you have all the condiments etc.  Clean and well cared for - validated parking , a HUGE outdoor patio . and Bryanna ….!  this is a perfect  10.  Loved it all !

A really lay back spot, very modern / casual spot to grab quick food, beer, play a little ping pong
Overall a great experience
Pizza was top tier.  Very creative and tasty.
Short dark skin lady was very friendly and descriptive w/ the menu
56$ for (2) pizzas (2) beers (2) sodas

So I did come here because of the infamy this place got from the Pizza Gate conspiracy and to prove a point that it's actually a pretty nice place and it got all this negative attention because Q followers decided to make this place the center of a made up controversy.

Go outside, touch grass, use your eyes, and most importantly, eat pizza.

Also the garlic knots are good.

Good beer, staff is really nice. Didn't get to play ping pong because they had live music that night but it was a good show. Ordered a margherita pizza as a "build your own" because it's not a menu item and unfortunately they use cherry tomatoes instead of sliced. Other than that everything was great.

Great food with vegan options. My family has gone here for years and they have always provided great service. Their dairy free cheese is honestly amazing. There are 3 ping pong tables in the back, so if you go during peak hours they will likely be occupied.

Great little place to visit for lunch or dinner. Amazing fires on pizzas with a ton of other options on the menu like sandwiches and salads. Several beers on tap, local and otherwise, as well as cans and bottles. Cocktails are available and the bartenders are knowledgeable. There are a handful of ping pong tables in the back that you can play with a bar and seating area for convenience. Prices are good, wait staff and tenders are great, and outdoor seating available.

i wish chevy chase was closer because i really love the food here. we ordered the last lobster they had and the chef would not serve it due to the quality not meeting his standards—integrity at its finest! everything tastes so fresh and clean. one of my favorites for sure! Definitely recommend.

The fish quality is pretty decent, very good value for money if you are here for basic sashimi. They don't put special fish on the menu, so make sure you ask the waitress/waiter. But don't expect too many varieties of fish available.
Buttery fatty tuna 🍣, best Make sashimi I’ve had in Maryland.  Highly recommend the sashimi or Nigiri scallops.
Everything was delicious and pretty reasonably priced. I love that they serve grated daikon with their shrimp tempura. Get the tempura, Hamachi kama, and brusell sprouts in addition to their sushi.

Good food, fast and good service (we were a little pressed for time and were in&out in 45 minutes).
We had the restaurant week tasting menu and nothing disappointed. The seaweed salad and fried eggplants were particularly tasty.
Nice & classy & best customer service. It's really 5 star quality. Loved it
Great clam chowder. Sirloin steak was delicious !  Had the home made grapefruit soda which was also delicious. The garlic truffle fries were 😋 yummy.
Gorgeous area. Clean and well kept. Traffic is a bit busy. Bring your wallets loaded.

Fun and diverse area for walking, shopping (higher-end to luxury), and dining. There is plenty to enjoy, all done in elegant style and taste. Whether having a nice little walk, out on a date, or a weekend out with the family you’ll have a great time with all there is to do in the area.

Beautiful place. What you expect from a 1st class shopping experience.  Last place in DC to purchase Chanel products including makeup. Parking is validated with a purchase only though,  so there's that. Dining options are limited and pricy.

I had first visited Le Chat Noir about 15 years ago, not long after they opened, and somehow had not made it back until Restaurant Week this year. And I'm glad I came back.

The physical space is pretty small and bareboned. The closeness of the tables reminded me of bistros in Europe. It's not as cozy as it could be, though, which is why I have the ambiance just 4 stars.

There seemed to be only three people working the tables, but they were excellent! Moving so quickly and ensuring everyone had everything they needed. The waiter who served us was French-speaking and happy to hear even a few words of French spoken back at him. He was lovely.

The cocktail and wine menu isn't super long, but all that's offered is superb. I enjoyed my Kir Royal and a glass of French Grenache.

And the food - that's the main reason to come! My husband and I got different things, so we could try two of everything, and were quite impressed with the quality. The Crepe Nana (with Roquefort and pear) was very unusual and very tasty. The pate was on par with other good French restaurants in DC. I thoroughly enjoyed my pork medallions, while my husband's steak was also quite good, though maybe not a full 5 (more like a solid 4). And both of the desserts (the profiterole with ice cream and the chocolate mouse) were outstanding.

All this is to say - definitely worth the visit. I personally want to try their brunch next!

Delicious food and great service. The wait staff was great and helped us navigate the wheel-chair ramp, and went out of their way to provide desserts that we requested that weren't on the menu. My dad and stepmom have been having dates here for over a decade and have had a number of events here too ♥️ Can't go wrong with Le Chat Noir!

I only ordered a creme brulee and a French baguette for delivery, the truth is that it feels authentic, the bread is delicious, hot with butter is out of this world and the creme brule delicious, I will definitely return to eat at the place to try their dishes.
Had a great time eating at Le Chat! Food was yummy, and we tried the suzette en flambé which was cool! People watching was also entertaining. Overall great experience and hope to return again soon!

was the most disappointing experience. We paid almost $150 for food that wasn't even decent. The creme brulee was just bad. There was no "creme" about it. It was so thick you could cut it with a knife and it didn't taste good. It's my favorite food ever and I threw it away. And it was tiny for the price. We ordered a $30 steak and it was the smallest little piece of meat with basic soggy fries. My husband got a crepe and it was pathetic. A tiny, messy, mound with Nutella more smeared on the container than in the crepe. If the meal was a quarter of the price it may of been a neutral experience. But a tiny creme brulee that I threw away isn't worth $14.

My experience at this nice restaurant was nothing short of perfect. The lychee fruit drink was outstanding. The Curry Laksa was so good, it made me want to buy a ticket to Kuala Lumpur. I definitely cannot forget about the Vietnamese Spring Rolls. They were delicious. The waitress was extremely cool and polite. She talked to us about Malaysia. I definitely will be returning here more frequently.
I moved here 3 months ago and this is the best Asian restaurant I've had in the DMV area so far. The roasted duck noodles are amazing and it feels like my hometown. The lamb satay is very addictive.

Very nice place. Our waitress was so kind and helpful. We had the veggie dumplings and roti canoi. The dumplings had a lot of filling and the roti canoi was incredible and my favorite overall. The pad see ew was pretty good and they had good vegetarian options to switch the orange chicken to a fake chicken.

Great Malaysian food in Washington DC, friendly staff members, reasonably priced. I had a to go order consisting of Beef Rendang and Char Kway Teoy. Both were delicious and authentic enough. The serving portion was also generous for the price. The rendang was tender and kway teoy also tastes great. Definitely would recommend this place!

An excellent family run Asian restaurant with wide array of Asian food selection. Reasonably priced and good quality food.

I was impressed by how quickly the food was prepared and served.

We ate here for lunch, and everything was good. We ordered kung pao chicken, eggplant in garlic sauce, pepper steak with onion, Hong Kong rice noodles with pork and shrimp, and pan-fried string bean Szechuan style. The service was quick, and the server was nice. We will also definitely be back to try their takeout options!

The food was delicious and came out quickly. We had general tso chicken and Singapore noodles. Both could have been a bit spicier, but very tasty. The steamed dumplings and spring rolls were cooked perfectly.

Things have changed and not for the better. I adore the food here, but the takeout experience is now really odd. You used to be able to go through the restaurant to the back area to pick up your food. It was easy, convenient, and you could use the elevator if you had any mobility issues.

Now you cannot access the takeout area through the restaurant and you have to go up a set of stairs in the back of the building the restaurant is located in (not accessible if you have mobility impairments). There are a few chairs set up and a plexiglass door staff members speak to you through. It’s pretty dirty and the trash room is there…it’s just strange.

I love the food here, but the current takeout system needs to change, please. This isn’t accessible or very clean. I’m hoping this is temporary!

Not sure what the dine in situation is, but the take out situation is the absolute worst customer experience I have ever had.

Whatever you do, do *not* pay ahead of time.
Good food, nicely set up restaurant. Service is quick, but not very friendly (perhaps they were too busy that day). Nice setting inside. Will be back.

I spotted this place as we drove by on a work detail and went back after we were done. I’m glad I did. I got the original steak & eggs. At $22 it was a little pricey but the food was of good quality. Everything had a fresh taste and appearance. The chocolate/banana milkshake was also a bit pricey at $8 but excellent as well. Good flavor and consistency. The restaurant had a bright, clean appearance and the staff was friendly & attentive. Due to the prices it’s not somewhere I’d frequent but I’d definitely go back if I was in the area.

The original greasy spoon has finally completed their renovations. Same food in a more comfortable space. Eggs and potatoes were the tastiest items. Didn't like the breakfast meats. Coffee could be better. The service was great.

This place is nice to chill and have a bite to eat. Took my son by there for breakfast and we loved it. The country fried steak with gravy and biscuits was delicious. The waffle was made with fresh blueberries and my son thought they were too sweet 😋 that says alot coming from a 11 yr old. Coffee was perfect to end such a hearty meal.  This place was a vibe I'll be back.

I loved it!! Wanted to try something new and asked what's popular. He recommended the Philly cheese steak. Hesitant since it's usually not my favorite but oh my god! It was great!! My favorite Philly cheese steak!! My boyfriend got the burger and it was really good for a diner style burger!! The fries, meat and bread was all great!! ❤️❤️ waiter was also very nice!!

The food was absolutely amazing! Yes, we spent like $40 per person but we got a lot of food to be fair. Besides, the price was WELL worth the portion sizes they give you. I've had salmon breakfast sandwiches many other places and I usually get 2 because they are so small, I did that here and that was a mistake. I was so full after just one. All of the food had a lot of flavor. It was only street parking, but typically you can find a spot close by. The people working their also seemed friendly. We will definitely be repeat customers; we'd choose Steak n' egg over IHOP any day.

Despite all the wonderful reviews this place wasn’t at all up to my expectations. My side caesar salad was good but the steak and cheese was truly a disappointment. All lettuce, tomato and onions very little meat and SO MUCH bread ! The staff was friendly and helpful. We were slightly chastised for ordering to go and sitting in their dining area which was slightly off putting and borderline rude as we made three different orders. I can’t confidently say I’d return but duly noted

I had a bus to catch and was feeling a bit hungry so I stopped in for something quick.  The staff was extremely helpful and I was able to get my food and get to the stop with plenty of time left over.  I probably had enough time to go back for another slice!  The pizza was amazing and I liked the amount given.  There was a bit of grease, but nothing some napkins won't fix.  Definitely looking forward to coming back in the future!

I ordered a pizza for delivery and it was dry and overcooked. A few days later I ordered chicken parm with a salad. The chicken parm didn't have enough sauce leaving the pasta at the bottom of the container plain and sticky. I was also given half of a sauce cup of dressing which wasn't enough for the amount of salad given. I wouldn't recommend eating here.

First time having Potomac Pizza... Normally I hate any pizza that's not NY Pizza... This place is AWESOME!
Fresh ingredients and crisp slices... Easily my new favorite pizza shop... Fyi 2 slices, 3 toppings each and a coke for $10.50...

Not the freshest food available, especially as I'm in walking distance. Service is really good, but the pizza, wings and garlic knots are average at best. Good in a pinch but don't expect anything special. Pass on the garlic knots despite how good it looks, its pretty dry and hard, as are the wings.

What an incredible dining experience! Excellent service from our server Abdul and manager Scott who made us feel like celebrities from the wine selection recommendations to the complimentary drinks and dessert. We highly recommend coming here for any celebration, as the staff will make it memorable for years to come.

We had a Birthday Lunch at Capital Grill in Bethesda. We were greeted at the entrance, wished Happy Birthday and escorted to our table. The table was decorated for my birthday. The food is excellent. Charles, our waiter spent time helping us. Birthday dessert was presented with a candle. Have a wonderful experience. Highly of recommend Capital Grill.

My wife and I celebrated our 21st wedding anniversary here together and were doted on like a king and queen. If you’re looking for a memorable experience, The Capital Grille is the place to be.

I absolutely loved the refined, yet welcoming atmosphere. Coupled with an amazing and attentive staff for the front of the house, our night was perfect to say the least. Abdul was exactly what I want in a server; personable, efficient, and not overly fussy. Abdul is hands down one of the best servers I’ve had in my dining experiences. We were also greeted by two of the managers who were very kind in wishing us a happy anniversary.

The food. OMG the FOOD!!! Started with the Korean influenced pork belly and the tuna tartare. I don’t think a better pairing exists and I would/will most likely go back just to have drinks and eat these appetizers again. Amazing. My wife had a scallop and risotto dish that was to “simply to die for”, her words lol that was created by the Sous Chef Benton. I had the bone in veal tomahawk chop and I couldn’t have been more happy. Absolutely delicious. A myriad of sides to accompany with dessert/espresso at the end, what more could we ask for?

I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone. You will not be disappointed. Absolutely stunning execution and attention to detail across the board. Thank you to everyone for making our anniversary “our night”. Can’t wait to see all of you again soon.

reviews.author_name: I SLAY ALL DAY TRAVEL The Solo Traveler
reviews.text: After a little shopping decided to come here for drink and small meal. It was fantastic.  I’ll definitely be back.  Great conversation with Nikki.  She is top self supreme customer service.

Amazing service, amazing food. I got the salmon they have and it was one of the best salmons I've ever been able to eat.

Also got a creme burlee, not the best one I've had but it was still super good. Can clearly see how much I hated the dish.

Roxana was the worst part of my dining experience she was moody, with money in my hands she chose to help a number of delivery guys making me wait. When I asked for a bag for my burrito bowl she chucked it at me!! And walked away. Never returning avoid this location at all cost

This Friday was my second time eating from this chipotle, the first time I went and stood in a long line during lunch hour and ordered. All went well and I had no issues with the food. This time, I ordered the same burrito for pickup from their app and something was definitely different this time. The burrito was unusually small and I was unable to eat it because it was not good and it seemed they put something in it that was intended to serve a devious purpose. Later that evening and all weekend I’ve had diarrhea. I won’t sue but I do know how karma works. I don’t know why some people wake up trying to inflict harm on someone they do not know. I will never understand such evil. I was just trying to give you’ll business, otherwise that’s not the type of cuisine I eat regularly.

The fastest chipotle I’ve been to thus far! I was at the end of a long line, assuming the worst - that I would have been waiting a long time. Nope, they sure proved me wrong. Isabelle the manager expedited my order and the rest of the staff worked together to get the line moving in such a fast paced manner.

Food is good, location is fine and there is outdoor seating. The employees are really stingy with the portions and rude. I come here just for the food, otherwise I would go to Potbelly or Roti where they have excellent customer service.

One (1) star because 0 isn’t available. The lady by the counter was incredibly rude and indicated that I shouldn’t eat there because I was disabled. Please ban her and upgrade this establishment to a finer standard of decorum.

As an annual patron at Matisse since 2014 I have to say that the atmosphere and food have made no compromises in light of the pandemic. This is an excellent place to escape for a meal with family and friends. Staff and chefs are fantastic and deliver excellence.

We went here for our anniversary and even listed that on the reservation. The food was good, but the service was all over the place. The beginning of our meal felt rushed and we were done with appetizers and entrees after 45-50 min. We were then presented the dessert menu and ordered. We did not end up receiving our dessert for another 40 minutes. Never were we told that there would be such a delay. If that had been the case because of a kitchen backup, we would have understood and chose not to have ordered a dessert. Instead we were stuck at our table with no one even stopping by to refill our drinks. We were left feeling like we had been forgotten - definitely not what you would want on a special night out.

Portion sizes also varied widely. My husband's meal was incredibly small while mine was almost too large. He would have left our expensive dinner hungry if mine wasn't large enough to share.

That was, my husband and I, our 1st time at Matisse.
The décor was quite elegant.
The menu offered a nice variety of dishes.
We all like the meals that we ordered.
It would have bee  perfect if:
-the $15 blueberry mojito had a little bit more rum. I could feel that it was super light, since after two sips of any alcoholic beverage, I already feel tipsy, feeling I did not get with it.
- If we could have had more bread. Once piece was only served at the beginning of the meal.
- If the music could have been less loud.
Almost a perfect evening!

I'm baffled. The night I ate at Matisse, the chicken was not fully cooked, I tasted 1 bite; very bland, the vegetables greasy, they served fries, like I was eating at McDonalds.  I ordered a white wine, and I later found out they gave me a lower label than I paid for.  This is NOT French cooking. When I was in Nice, $7 got me the best coq au vin; this restaurant's food is like a fast-cook diner. K. Steinhart

Food was better than expected. Oysters were sublime, and the lamb was cooked to perfection. The sauce paired perfectly! Only word of caution is if its for a special occasion, I specified a birthday on the celebration - but there was nothing special out of the kitchen to that end

I've worked as a delivery driver for almost 2 years. What I did not like about working for this company was, I was basically getting robbed. I was always getting underpaid. I was working part-time but my paycheck was always at least $200 short. The assistant manager, Brent is a great guy, it's just I did not appreciate how little I was getting paid.

Not good business practice. The app said my pizza was deliver but it was not. I called to check on delivery status but no one picked up my call tried calling to speak with manager no one picked up I will not order from here again
They made the exact food with the perfect aroma and taste.

So I like ordering my pizza from this location. It's very close to my job. My last encounter with them was today and the lady who I spole with on the phone was so nasty. I mean she kept cutting me off, not listening to anything I was saying. I believe customer service is important and if you want people to support to business you can't be rude. It's not my fault that you don't have enough workers on staff. If I'm paying for your food, then I expect to be treated with respect. Then I called again to find out the status of my pizza and I was put on hold for almost 20 minutes. Again...poor customer service. I don't get it. I'm very upset about this. I've missed my lunch time and I gotta warm up the pizza that I paid for to be warm. Unacceptable. food is good, service leaves MUCH to be desired.

Rude!!!! Worst place ever!!!!!  We ordered online n picked it up and the lady was so rude. I told her our order was ready for pickup and she said you gave you wait five min. And when I added soda she told me to wait another five minutes because she was busy. After five min asking again she was so rude and said next time I N won’t give out unless you pay online. I mean what the hell is that. Never going here again!!!!!
Nice look. Clean, open layout. I've gone here for Clyde's and the Capital One bank. Haven't visited any other establishment here yet.

Friendship Heights is completely different from what it was thirty years ago. It has less shops and it's understandable with COVID and the economy is tough to keep businesses open. I liked it then. The shops there today aren't fit for my needs anymore
Has a nice collection of upscale stores, restaurants, and other useful businesses. Includes Amazon Fresh grocery store. Good parking, convenient access by car, Metro, or bus.

Just went to have lunch at clydes at the collection.
.very nice.
Love this place. Very nice area to spend an afternoon, the shops are all clean and high end. The restaurants are great. Nice area to walk and shop from.

Today I stopped by this spot for the first time for lunch after a business meeting and it did not disappoint. Rod was my bartender and was very knowledgeable of the menu and made great recommendations. The grilled cheese with chicken was amazing and the gumbo was supposed to be taken home for later but my spoon would not stay still. Oh and the DMV Manhattan was really nice. I was also fortunate to have a quick convo with the owner, Chris. Good guy and overall great place. I highly recommend it and don’t forget to check out their restroom. I know that sounds weird, but it looks better than some residential bathrooms! I’ll be back for dinner!

It's been a staple in the neighborhood for a reason. Fried chicken Mondays. BLT deviled eggs. Fish tacos. Etc etc. A variety of good options. Even the Caesar salad is really good. Outdoor patio or indoor restaurant, it's a cozy and comfortable environment to enjoy a nice local restaurant

By far the BEST gumbo in town, now that Acadiana and Louisiana Kitchen have closed. Can't wait to go back and try their award winning Fried Chicken on Mondays. Good menu selections for vegans and gluten sensitives too.

Wonderful restaurant! The fried oysters and blueberry fields salad are fantastic and worth the trip alone. Outside of that I am a huge fan of their Pittsburgh cheesesteak.

The owner is also almost always on the floor and you can tell how much he cares. Really creates a different vibe and a welcoming environment.

I’ve only been here for the bar so cannot give an opinion on the food. The bar however is very nice. I like it because it’s small and tucked away in the back. The bartenders are always nice and the place is always clean. Great for a quick drink.

Yosaku has been my family's go-to restaurant for years. We love that there is something for everyone: the meat-eaters, the fish-lover, and the vegetarian. The vegetable sushi dinner, seaweed salads, bean sprouts, agedashi tofu, and teriyaki salmon are particularly delicious. 10/10 recommend! Come support Yosaku!

Great service, the waitress was very accomodating and very nice. The fastest we ever had Sushi deliver to the table. Food was awesome!!! The environment was intimate and quiet. They have Happy Hour Sushi everyday from 5-7:30, too bad we got there late, but it was worth it. Whenever we come back to Washington DC, we're definitely coming back. Highly recommend it.

This is the real deal if you're looking for really authentic Japanese food! There are some dishes here that you wont easily find at your average Japanese restaurant, like sukiyaki or unagi. Definitely worth it to come here!

Reasonable Japanese lunch at $9-12. On Mondays you'll get happy hour price all day, sushi (nigiri) $1 each. Sushi is a bit dry but ok. Shimesaba sushi (mackerel seasoned in vinegar) is my favorite. Nabeyaki udon was great! One of the pitfalls was the bathroom. It was clean but the whole area near bathroom was stinky. Another was that they had hot tea but served us cold water without asking.

I hadn't been for ages, due to COVID. I realize now that I should have gone back ages ago! The food is delicious and the service is excellent. I had the bento box lunch with mackerel and enjoyed every bite!
Good food and service in a bright and cheerful setting.  The chips had both hot and cold dips and the Steak Quesadillas ($15.95) were delicious.   Conveniently located by the Tenleytown Metro.
We had a great time at Guapo's.  We our office Christmas party here and it was awesome.  The food was delicious and if you like traditional Mexican food then you will live this place.

Great Mexican food!  They have a large menu with many good options. Classics like tacos, enchiladas and fajitas are sure to please. I found that they are very fast bringing the food out too which is really nice.  Plenty of indoor and some outdoor seating as well. Excellent service rounds it all out!
Guapos is awesome. They are always consistent with the quality of their good. This location is one of my favorites.

Great service. This location has outdoor tables w/large umbrellas for shading. Servers all wearing masks. Masks required inside, except when eating, of course.

On-street metered parking using coins or Park Mobile app. Covered parking lot nearby for local shops. Guapo's may validate.

Food was decent. We ordered El Paso tacos (2 chicken & 1 beef), chicken & spinach quesadilla 😋, a side of rice & black beans, and a coke. Food lukewarm. Sides were cold. Refried beans looked and tasted like pureed. Overall, good experience.
